section.title: File Operations Principle
section.mandate: ALL file operations must be verified, safe, and educational
section.technical-explanation: File operation safety prevents data loss, corruption, and system instability
section.simple-explanation: Like double-checking before cutting paper - measure twice, cut once

requirements.requirement: Use find command for comprehensive searches

educational-example.technical-explanation: Explicit path verification prevents relative path ambiguity in different execution contexts
educational-example.simple-explanation: Like giving someone the full street address instead of "the house near the store"
educational-example.learning: Absolute paths work from anywhere, relative paths depend on where you are

educational-example.technical-explanation: find command provides comprehensive filesystem traversal with type filtering
educational-example.simple-explanation: Like having a search dog that can find specific types of items in every corner
educational-example.learning: find searches everything, ls only shows what's visible in current directory

requirements.requirement: Check git status before bulk operations
Use -i flag for interactive confirmation when risky

educational-example.technical-explanation: Interactive confirmation prevents accidental destructive operations in production
educational-example.simple-explanation: Like asking "Are you sure?" before permanently deleting family photos
educational-example.learning: -i flag makes commands ask before doing potentially dangerous things

pitfalls.pitfall: Hidden folders may not show in basic ls
Shell expansion may not work as expected

educational-solution.technical-explanation: Hidden files (starting with .) are excluded by default in ls for security
educational-solution.simple-explanation: Like secret files that are only visible when you specifically look for them
educational-solution.command: ls -la to see ALL files including hidden ones
educational-solution.learning: Many config files are hidden to prevent accidental modification
